{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06795v1", "title": "Winning and nullity of inhomogeneous bad", "summary": "We prove the hyperplane absolute winning property of weighted inhomogeneous
badly approximable vectors in $\mathbb{R}^d$. This answers a question by
Beresnevich--Nesharim--Yang and extends the main result of [Geometric and
Functional Analysis, 31 (1), 1-33, 2021] to the inhomogeneous set-up.
  We also show for any nondegenerate curve and nondegenerate analytic manifold
that almost every point is not weighted inhomogeneous badly approximable for
any weight. This is achieved by duality and the quantitative nondivergence
estimates from homogeneous dynamics motivated by [Acta Math. 231 (2023), 1-30],
together with the methods from [arXiv:2307.10109].", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT,math.DS", "published": "2025-04-09T11:38:28Z"}
